message.content:
You are a final release validator for a product guides system. Verify that all previous issues have been fixed and the system is ready for production release.

VERIFICATION CHECKLIST:

1. **Product Registry Completeness** (src/data/guides/products-registry.ts):
   - All 73 products have 5 regions (us, uk, de, fr, au)
   - All products have unique images (no duplicates)
   - All required fields present (id, name, brand, category, tagline, description, priority, priceRange, regionLinks, imageUrl)

2. **Guide Content Completeness** (src/data/guides/*.ts):
   - All guides have heroMedia
   - All productIds reference valid products in the registry
   - All relatedGuides reference valid guide slugs
   - All guides have at least 2 sections

3. **Type Safety** (src/types/guides.ts):
   - GuideProduct interface matches actual product structure
   - Guide interface matches actual guide structure

4. **Helper Functions** (src/data/guides/products-registry.ts, src/data/guides/index.ts):
   - getGuideProductById works with aliases
   - getGuidesByCategory returns correct results
   - searchGuides function works

5. **Region System** (src/lib/region.ts, src/contexts/RegionContext.tsx):
   - buildAmazonUrl generates correct URLs for all 6 regions
   - RegionContext provides useRegion hook

Run these checks and provide a PASS/FAIL status for each category with specific issues found. This is the final gate before production release.

content.text: I'll perform a comprehensive validation of the product guides system. Let me start by examining all the relevant files.

     3â†’ * 73 products with multi-region affiliate links and Ross-style taglines
     4â†’ * Categories: hygiene, grooming, skincare, miscellaneous, supplements, hair, beard, teeth, kbeauty, hormonal, surgery

    10â†’// ============================================
    11â†’// AMAZON ASIN MAPPING BY REGION
    12â†’// ============================================
    13â†’
    14â†’interface ProductASINs {
    15â†’  us?: string;
    16â†’  uk?: string;
    17â†’  de?: string;
    18â†’  fr?: string;
    19â†’  au?: string;
    20â†’}
    21â†’
    22â†’// Regions that have Amazon stores with ASINs
    23â†’type AmazonRegion = 'us' | 'uk' | 'de' | 'fr' | 'au';
    24â†’const AMAZON_REGIONS: AmazonRegion[] = ['us', 'uk', 'de', 'fr', 'au'];
    25â†’
    26â†’// Helper to build region links from ASINs
    27â†’function buildRegionLinks(asins: ProductASINs): Record<string, string> {
    28â†’  const links: Record<string, string> = {};
    29â†’
    30â†’  AMAZON_REGIONS.forEach(region => {
    31â†’    const asin = asins[region] || asins.us; // Fallback to US ASIN
    32â†’    if (asin) {
    33â†’      links[region] = buildAmazonUrl(asin, region);
    34â†’    }
    35â†’  });
    36â†’
    37â†’  // Asia uses US ASIN on amzn.asia domain
    38â†’  if (asins.us) {
    39â†’    links['asia'] = buildAmazonUrl(asins.us, 'asia');
    40â†’  }
    41â†’
    42â†’  return links;
    43â†’}

/**
 * Product Registry for Guides System
 * 73 products with multi-region affiliate links and Ross-style taglines
 * Categories: hygiene, grooming, skincare, miscellaneous, supplements, hair, beard, teeth, kbeauty, hormonal, surgery
 */

import { GuideProduct, ProductCategory } from '@/types/guides';
import { buildAmazonUrl } from '@/lib/region';

// ============================================
// AMAZON ASIN MAPPING BY REGION
// ============================================

interface ProductASINs {
  us?: string;
  uk?: string;
  de?: string;
  fr?: string;
  au?: string;
}

// Regions that have Amazon stores with ASINs
type AmazonRegion = 'us' | 'uk' | 'de' | 'fr' | 'au';
const AMAZON_REGIONS: AmazonRegion[] = ['us', 'uk', 'de', 'fr', 'au'];

// Helper to build region links from ASINs
function buildRegionLinks(asins: ProductASINs): Record<string, string> {
  const links: Record<string, string> = {};

  AMAZON_REGIONS.forEach(region => {
    const asin = asins[region] || asins.us; // Fallback to US ASIN
    if (asin) {
      links[region] = buildAmazonUrl(asin, region);
    }
  });

  // Asia uses US ASIN on amzn.asia domain
  if (asins.us) {
    links['asia'] = buildAmazonUrl(asins.us, 'asia');
  }

  return links;
}

// ============================================
// PRODUCT DATABASE (33 Products)
// ============================================

export const GUIDE_PRODUCTS: GuideProduct[] = [
  // ============================================
  // HYGIENE (4 products)
  // ============================================
  {
    id: 'tongue_scraper',
    name: 'Stainless Steel Tongue Scraper',
    brand: 'MasterMedi',
    category: 'hygiene',
    tagline: "Your breath is out here committing war crimes and you don't even know it.",
    description: 'Medical-grade stainless steel tongue scraper. Removes bacteria and sulfur compounds that cause bad breath. Takes 10 seconds, lasts forever.',
    priority: 1,
    priceRange: { min: 7, max: 12, currency: 'USD' },
    regionLinks: buildRegionLinks({
      us: 'B091G5CH14',
      uk: 'B091G5CH14',
      de: 'B091G5CH14',
      fr: 'B091G5CH14',
      au: 'B091G5CH14',
    }),
    imageUrl: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1609587312208-cea54be969e7?w=200&h=200&fit=crop',
    isBaseStack: true,
  },
  {
    id: 'cologne_bleu',
    name: 'Bleu de Chanel EDT',
    brand: 'Chanel',
    category: 'hygiene',
    tagline: "Stop smelling like your high school gym locker. This ain't Axe bodyspray era anymore.",
    description: 'Clean, versatile, universally liked. The safe choice that works for 99% of situations. Not cheap, but compliment-to-dollar ratio is unmatched.',
    priority: 2,
    priceRange: { min: 80, max: 150, currency: 'USD' },
    regionLinks: buildRegionLinks({
      us: 'B01N4P3WC3',
      uk: 'B01N4P3WC3',

// ============================================
// HELPER FUNCTIONS
// ============================================

/**
 * Product ID aliases for backwards compatibility
 * Maps shorthand IDs to full product IDs
 */
const PRODUCT_ID_ALIASES: Record<string, string> = {
  // Supplements
  ashwagandha: 'ashwagandha_ksm66',
  creatine: 'creatine_mono',
  omega_3: 'omega3_fish_oil',
  zinc: 'zinc_picolinate',
  // Add more as needed
};

/**
 * Get product by ID (supports aliases)
 */
export function getGuideProductById(id: string): GuideProduct | undefined {
  // Resolve alias if it exists
  const resolvedId = PRODUCT_ID_ALIASES[id] || id;
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS.find(p => p.id === resolvedId);
}

/**
 * Get all products in a category
 */
export function getGuideProductsByCategory(category: ProductCategory): GuideProduct[] {
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS
    .filter(p => p.category === category)
    .sort((a, b) => a.priority - b.priority);
}

/**
 * Get all base stack products (essentials for everyone)
 */
export function getBaseStackProducts(): GuideProduct[] {
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS
    .filter(p => p.isBaseStack)
    .sort((a, b) => a.priority - b.priority);
}

/**
 * Get products by priority level
 */
export function getGuideProductsByPriority(priority: number): GuideProduct[] {
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS.filter(p => p.priority === priority);
}

/**
 * Get all unique categories with product counts
 */
export function getProductCategories(): Array<{ category: ProductCategory; count: number }> {
  const categories: ProductCategory[] = [
    'hygiene',
    'grooming',
    'skincare',
    'miscellaneous',
    'supplements',
    'hair',
    'beard',
    'teeth',
    'kbeauty',
    'hormonal',
    'surgery',
  ];

  return categories.map(category => ({
    category,
    count: GUIDE_PRODUCTS.filter(p => p.category === category).length,
  }));
}

/**
 * Get products by array of IDs (preserves order)
 */
export function getGuideProductsByIds(ids: string[]): GuideProduct[] {
  return ids
    .map(id => getGuideProductById(id))
    .filter((p): p is GuideProduct => p !== undefined);
}

/**
 * Search products by name or description
 */
export function searchGuideProducts(query: string): GuideProduct[] {
  const lowered = query.toLowerCase();
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS.filter(p =>
    p.name.toLowerCase().includes(lowered) ||
    p.description.toLowerCase().includes(lowered) ||
    p.tagline.toLowerCase().includes(lowered) ||
    (p.brand && p.brand.toLowerCase().includes(lowered))
  );
}

/**
 * Get total product count
 */
export function getTotalProductCount(): number {
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS.length;
}

/**
 * Get category display info
 */
export function getCategoryDisplayInfo(category: ProductCategory): {
  name: string;
  icon: string;
  description: string;
} {
  const info: Record<ProductCategory, { name: string; icon: string; description: string }> = {
    hygiene: {
      name: 'Hygiene',
      icon: 'Sparkles',
      description: 'Fundamentals of not repelling people',
    },
    grooming: {
      name: 'Grooming',
      icon: 'Scissors',
      description: 'Tools for precision face maintenance',
    },
    skincare: {
      name: 'Skincare',
      icon: 'Droplet',
      description: 'Your skin is your face. Treat it right.',
    },
    miscellaneous: {
      name: 'Miscellaneous',
      icon: 'Package',
      description: 'The supporting cast of your glow-up',
    },
    supplements: {
      name: 'Supplements',
      icon: 'Pill',
      description: 'Fill the gaps your diet is missing',
    },
    hair: {
      name: 'Hair',
      icon: 'Wind',
      description: 'The Big 3 and beyondâ€”save what you have',
    },
    beard: {
      name: 'Beard',
      icon: 'User',
      description: 'Grow it, groom it, own it',
    },
    teeth: {
      name: 'Teeth',
      icon: 'Smile',
      description: 'Your smile is worth more than you think',
    },
    kbeauty: {
      name: 'K-Beauty',
      icon: 'Sparkle',
      description: 'Glass skin protocols from Seoul',
    },
    hormonal: {
      name: 'Hormonal',
      icon: 'Heart',
      description: 'PCOS, hormonal acne, and balance',
    },
    surgery: {
      name: 'Surgery',
      icon: 'Stethoscope',
      description: 'Post-op recovery essentials',
    },
  };

  return info[category];
}

content.text: Now let me examine some of the guide files to verify they have heroMedia, valid productIds, and relatedGuides. Let me check several guides:

content.content:
1â†’/**
     2â†’ * Mindset & Beginner Mistakes Guide
     3â†’ * Humor Level: High (30%)
     4â†’ */
     5â†’
     6â†’import { Guide } from '@/types/guides';
     7â†’
     8â†’export const mindsetGuide: Guide = {
     9â†’  id: 'mindset',
    10â†’  slug: 'mindset-mistakes',
    11â†’  title: 'Mindset & Beginner Mistakes',
    12â†’  subtitle: "The cope stops here",
    13â†’  description: "Before you spend a dime, fix the mental game. Most guys sabotage themselves before they even start.",
    14â†’  icon: 'Brain',
    15â†’  humorLevel: 'high',
    16â†’  estimatedReadTime: 8,
    17â†’  order: 1,
    18â†’  tags: ['mindset', 'beginners', 'fundamentals'],
    19â†’  relatedGuides: ['maintenance', 'body-fat'],
    20â†’  productIds: [],
    21â†’  forumCategory: 'anxiety',
    22â†’  heroMedia: {
    23â†’    id: 'mindset-hero',
    24â†’    type: 'image',
    25â†’    url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1507003211169-0a1dd7228f2d?w=1200&q=80',
    26â†’    alt: 'Focused mindset and determination',
    27â†’    placement: 'hero',
    28â†’  },
    29â†’  sections: [
    30â†’    {
    31â†’      id: 'intro',
    32â†’      title: 'The Real Talk',
    33â†’      humorLevel: 'high',
    34â†’      content: `You're here because you want to look better. Good. That's the first step.
    35â†’
    36â†’But here's what nobody tells you: **most guys fail not because they don't know what to do, but because their mindset is cooked from day one.**
    37â†’
    38â†’They're either:
    39â†’- Paralyzed by analysis (reading guides instead of taking action)
    40â†’- Expecting overnight results (then quitting after 2 weeks)
    41â†’- Comparing themselves to genetic outliers (and feeling defeated)
    42â†’- Looking for shortcuts (spoiler: there aren't any)
    43â†’
    44â†’This guide is about fixing that before you waste months spinning your wheels.`,
    45â†’      media: [
    46â†’        {
    47â†’          id: 'mindset-intro',
    48â†’          type: 'image',
    49â†’          url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1552674605-db6ffd4facb5?w=800&q=80',
    50â†’          alt: 'Man focused on goals',
    51â†’          caption: 'The mindset game starts before everything else',
    52â†’          placement: 'inline',
    53â†’        },
    54â†’        {
    55â†’          id: 'level-up-gif',
    56â†’          type: 'gif',
    57â†’          url: 'https://media.giphy.com/media/H9l0FtwC2hA3V7Bj5H/giphy.gif',
    58â†’          alt: 'Level Up pixel animation',
    59â†’          caption: 'Time to level up',
    60â†’          placement: 'inline',
    61â†’        },
    62â†’      ],
    63â†’    },
    64â†’    {
    65â†’      id: 'mistake-1-perfectionism',
    66â†’      title: 'Mistake #1: Waiting for the "Perfect" Plan',
    67â†’      humorLevel: 'high',
    68â†’      content: `You've bookmarked 47 articles. You've saved 200 Instagram posts. You've downloaded 12 PDFs. You've done exactly **zero** actual work.
    69â†’
    70â†’**This ain't it, chief.**
    71â†’
    72â†’The perfect routine doesn't exist. There's no secret combination of products and exercises that will unlock chad-tier genetics. There's just consistent effort over time.
    73â†’
    74â†’Here's the brutal truth: a mediocre plan executed consistently beats a perfect plan you never start.
    75â†’
    76â†’**Action Step:** Pick ONE thing from this app to improve. Just one. Do it for 30 days before adding anything else.`,
    77â†’      tips: [
    78â†’        'Done is better than perfect',
    79â†’        'Consistency beats intensity every single time',
    80â†’        'Start before you feel ready'
    81â†’      ],
    82â†’      media: [
    83â†’        {
    84â†’          id: 'perfectionism-trap',
    85â†’          type: 'image',
    86â†’          url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1484480974693-6ca0a78fb36b?w=800&q=80',
    87â†’          alt: 'Planning and action',
    88â†’          caption: 'Stop planning, start doing',
    89â†’          placement: 'inline',
    90â†’        },
    91â†’      ],
    92â†’    },
    93â†’    {
    94â†’      id: 'mistake-2-timeline',
    95â†’      title: 'Mistake #2: Expecting Fast Results',
    96â†’      humorLevel: 'medium-high',
    97â†’      content: `You started mewing yesterday and you're checking your jawline in the mirror this morning. Bro.
    98â†’
    99â†’Real change takes **months to years**, depending on what you're working on:
   100â†’
   101â†’| Change | Timeline |
   102â†’|--------|----------|
   103â†’| Better skin (routine) | 6-12 weeks |
   104â†’| Body recomposition | 3-6 months |
   105â†’| Posture improvement | 3-6 months |
   106â†’| Hair regrowth (minox) | 6-12 months |
   107â†’| Mewing (adults) | 1-2+ years |
   108â†’
   109â†’**The guys who win are the ones who forget about results and just lock in on the process.**
   110â†’
   111â†’Think about it: if you had started 6 months ago, you'd already be there. You didn't. So start now and stop checking daily.`,
   112â†’      warnings: [
   113â†’        'Taking progress photos daily will drive you insane',
   114â†’        'Monthly or bi-monthly comparison photos are enough'
   115â†’      ],
   116â†’    },
   117â†’    {
   118â†’      id: 'mistake-3-comparison',
   119â†’      title: 'Mistake #3: Comparing to Genetic Outliers',
   120â†’      humorLevel: 'high',
   121â†’      content: `You're comparing yourself to guys who:
   122â†’- Won the genetic lottery
   123â†’- Have professional lighting in every photo
   124â†’- Are on gear and won't admit it
   125â†’- Use filters/editing
   126â†’- Got surgery and claim "just mewing bro"
   127â†’
   128â†’**This is NPC behavior.**
   129â†’
   130â†’Here's a better frame: you're not trying to become someone else. You're trying to mog your past self. That's it.
   131â†’
   132â†’Your only competition is the guy you were 6 months ago. If he'd be jealous of where you are now, you're winning.`,
   133â†’      tips: [
   134â†’        'Mog your past self, not strangers on the internet',
   135â†’        'Unfollow accounts that make you feel like garbage',
   136â†’        'Follow for information, not comparison'
   137â†’      ],
   138â†’    },
   139â†’    {
   140â†’      id: 'mistake-4-shortcuts',
   141â†’      title: 'Mistake #4: Looking for Shortcuts',
   142â†’      humorLevel: 'medium-high',

   197â†’Don't level skip. The expensive stuff doesn't work if the foundation is garbage.
   198â†’
   199â†’Surgery on a 25% body fat face is like putting a spoiler on a Honda Civic. Fix the car first.`,
   200â†’      warnings: [

   202â†’        'Get to 12% body fat before considering facial procedures'
   203â†’      ],
   204â†’    },
   205â†’    {
   206â†’      id: 'the-real-strategy',
   207â†’      title: 'The Actual Strategy That Works',

   209â†’      content: `Here's what the successful guys do:

   216â†’

   230â†’      tips: [

/**
 * Mindset & Beginner Mistakes Guide
 * Humor Level: High (30%)
 */

import { Guide } from '@/types/guides';

export const mindsetGuide: Guide = {
  id: 'mindset',
  slug: 'mindset-mistakes',
  title: 'Mindset & Beginner Mistakes',
  subtitle: "The cope stops here",
  description: "Before you spend a dime, fix the mental game. Most guys sabotage themselves before they even start.",
  icon: 'Brain',
  humorLevel: 'high',
  estimatedReadTime: 8,
  order: 1,
  tags: ['mindset', 'beginners', 'fundamentals'],
  relatedGuides: ['maintenance', 'body-fat'],
  productIds: [],
  forumCategory: 'anxiety',
  heroMedia: {
    id: 'mindset-hero',
    type: 'image',
    url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1507003211169-0a1dd7228f2d?w=1200&q=80',
    alt: 'Focused mindset and determination',
    placement: 'hero',
  },
  sections: [
    {
      id: 'intro',
      title: 'The Real Talk',
      humorLevel: 'high',
      content: `You're here because you want to look better. Good. That's the first step.

But here's what nobody tells you: **most guys fail not because they don't know what to do, but because their mindset is cooked from day one.**

They're either:
- Paralyzed by analysis (reading guides instead of taking action)
- Expecting overnight results (then quitting after 2 weeks)
- Comparing themselves to genetic outliers (and feeling defeated)
- Looking for shortcuts (spoiler: there aren't any)

This guide is about fixing that before you waste months spinning your wheels.`,
      media: [
        {
          id: 'mindset-intro',
          type: 'image',
          url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1552674605-db6ffd4facb5?w=800&q=80',
          alt: 'Man focused on goals',
          caption: 'The mindset game starts before everything else',
          placement: 'inline',
        },
        {
          id: 'level-up-gif',
          type: 'gif',
          url: 'https://media.giphy.com/media/H9l0FtwC2hA3V7Bj5H/giphy.gif',
          alt: 'Level Up pixel animation',
          caption: 'Time to level up',
          placement: 'inline',
        },
      ],
    },
    {
      id: 'mistake-1-perfectionism',
      title: 'Mistake #1: Waiting for the "Perfect" Plan',
      humorLevel: 'high',
      content: `You've bookmarked 47 articles. You've saved 200 Instagram posts. You've downloaded 12 PDFs. You've done exactly **zero** actual work.

**This ain't it, chief.**

The perfect routine doesn't exist. There's no secret combination of products and exercises that will unlock chad-tier genetics. There's just consistent effort over time.

Here's the brutal truth: a mediocre plan executed consistently beats a perfect plan you never start.

**Action Step:** Pick ONE thing from this app to improve. Just one. Do it for 30 days before adding anything else.`,
      tips: [
        'Done is better than perfect',
        'Consistency beats intensity every single time',
        'Start before you feel ready'
      ],
      media: [
        {
          id: 'perfectionism-trap',
          type: 'image',
          url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1484480974693-6ca0a78fb36b?w=800&q=80',
          alt: 'Planning and action',
          caption: 'Stop planning, start doing',
          placement: 'inline',
        },
      ],
    },
    {
      id: 'mistake-2-timeline',
      title: 'Mistake #2: Expecting Fast Results',
      humorLevel: 'medium-high',
      content: `You started mewing yesterday and you're checking your jawline in the mirror this morning. Bro.

Real change takes **months to years**, depending on what you're working on:

| Change | Timeline |
|--------|----------|
| Better skin (routine) | 6-12 weeks |
| Body recomposition | 3-6 months |
| Posture improvement | 3-6 months |
| Hair regrowth (minox) | 6-12 months |
| Mewing (adults) | 1-2+ years |

**The guys who win are the ones who forget about results and just lock in on the process.**

Think about it: if you had started 6 months ago, you'd already be there. You didn't. So start now and stop checking daily.`,
      warnings: [
        'Taking progress photos daily will drive you insane',
        'Monthly or bi-monthly comparison photos are enough'
      ],
    },
    {
      id: 'mistake-3-comparison',
      title: 'Mistake #3: Comparing to Genetic Outliers',
      humorLevel: 'high',
      content: `You're comparing yourself to guys who:
- Won the genetic lottery
- Have professional lighting in every photo
- Are on gear and won't admit it
- Use filters/editing
- Got surgery and claim "just mewing bro"

**This is NPC behavior.**

Here's a better frame: you're not trying to become someone else. You're trying to mog your past self. That's it.

Your only competition is the guy you were 6 months ago. If he'd be jealous of where you are now, you're winning.`,
      tips: [
        'Mog your past self, not strangers on the internet',
        'Unfollow accounts that make you feel like garbage',
        'Follow for information, not comparison'
      ],
    },
    {
      id: 'mistake-4-shortcuts',
      title: 'Mistake #4: Looking for Shortcuts',
      humorLevel: 'medium-high',
      content: `There are no shortcuts. There are no hacks. There is no "one weird trick."

The internet is full of people trying to sell you things you don't need:
- Miracle supplements that do nothing
- Expensive gadgets that collect dust
- "Secret" techniques that are just repackaged basics

**Here's what actually works:**
1. Sleep 7-9 hours
2. Eat enough protein
3. Lift weights
4. Use sunscreen
5. Stay lean
6. Groom yourself

That's 90% of it. Everything else is optimization on top of this foundation. If you're not doing these six things consistently, nothing else matters.`,
    },
    {
      id: 'mistake-5-all-or-nothing',
      title: 'Mistake #5: All-or-Nothing Thinking',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `You miss one gym session and think "welp, the whole week is ruined."
You eat one bad meal and say "might as well order pizza for the rest of the week."
You skip your skincare once and abandon the routine entirely.

**This is self-sabotage with extra steps.**

Progress isn't linear. Life happens. The goal isn't perfectionâ€”it's **consistency over time**.

Missing one day means nothing. Missing one day, then letting it spiral into one week, then one month? That's the killer.

**The rule:** If you miss, just get back on track the next opportunity. No guilt, no drama. Just reset and continue.`,
      tips: [
        'One bad day is noise. One bad month is a pattern.',
        "Never miss twice in a rowâ€”that's the real rule",
        'Lower the bar if needed, but show up'
      ],
    },
    {
      id: 'mistake-6-money-before-basics',
      title: 'Mistake #6: Spending Money Before Basics',
      humorLevel: 'high',
      content: `You're researching jaw implants but you're at 22% body fat.
You want Botox but you've never worn sunscreen.
You're considering hair transplants but you sleep 5 hours a night.

**You're skipping chapters, my guy.**

Here's the priority order:
1. **Free tier:** Sleep, hydration, basic hygiene, mewing, posture
2. **Low cost ($20-50/mo):** Gym, skincare basics, grooming tools
3. **Medium cost ($50-200/mo):** Supplements, better products, minoxidil
4. **High cost ($500+):** Treatments, procedures, surgery

Don't level skip. The expensive stuff doesn't work if the foundation is garbage.

Surgery on a 25% body fat face is like putting a spoiler on a Honda Civic. Fix the car first.`,
      warnings: [
        "Surgery doesn't fix lifestyle problems",
        'Get to 12% body fat before considering facial procedures'
      ],
    },
    {
      id: 'the-real-strategy',
      title: 'The Actual Strategy That Works',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `Here's what the successful guys do:

**1. Accept the timeline**
You're playing a 1-2 year game minimum. Accept that now or quit.

**2. Build systems, not goals**
"I want a better jawline" is a goal. "I chew mastic gum for 20 minutes after every meal" is a system. Systems win.

**3. Track ruthlessly**
Take monthly photos. Same lighting, same angle, same expression. This is the only objective measure.

**4. Iterate slowly**
Add one new thing every 4-6 weeks. Not five things at once. You need to know what's actually working.

**5. Focus on the 80/20**
20% of actions produce 80% of results. For most guys:
- Getting lean (diet + exercise)
- Skincare (cleanser, moisturizer, sunscreen)
- Grooming (hair, brows, facial hair)

**Nail these before anything else.**`,
      tips: [
        'Progress compounds over time',
        'Small daily actions beat occasional big efforts',
        'Document everything so you can see the change'
      ],
      media: [
        {
          id: 'strategy-visual',
          type: 'image',
          url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1434596922112-19c563067271?w=800&q=80',
          alt: 'Progress and tracking',
          caption: 'Track ruthlessly, iterate slowly',
          placement: 'inline',
        },
      ],
    },
    {
      id: 'closing',
      title: 'Lock In',
      humorLevel: 'high',
      content: `The cope stops here. No more excuses. No more "I'll start Monday." No more blaming genetics.

You have all the information you need. This app, this guide, these toolsâ€”they're more than enough.

The only question is whether you're actually going to do the work or just read about it and go back to whatever you were doing before.

**Your move.**

Mog your past self. That's the whole game.`,
    },
  ],
};

1â†’/**
     2â†’ * Skincare & Acne Guide
     3â†’ * Humor Level: Medium (15%)
     4â†’ */
     5â†’
     6â†’import { Guide } from '@/types/guides';
     7â†’
     8â†’export const skincareGuide: Guide = {
     9â†’  id: 'skincare',
    10â†’  slug: 'skincare-acne',
    11â†’  title: 'Skincare & Acne',
    12â†’  subtitle: "Your skin is your face. Treat it right.",
    13â†’  description: "Evidence-based skincare routines for clear, healthy skin. From basics to advanced treatments like tretinoin.",
    14â†’  icon: 'Droplet',
    15â†’  humorLevel: 'medium',
    16â†’  estimatedReadTime: 12,
    17â†’  order: 9,
    18â†’  tags: ['skincare', 'acne', 'anti-aging', 'routine', 'tretinoin'],
    19â†’  relatedGuides: ['maintenance', 'body-fat', 'diet'],
    20â†’  productIds: [
    21â†’    'cerave_cleanser',
    22â†’    'cerave_moisturizer',
    23â†’    'sunscreen_elta',
    24â†’    'aquaphor_lip',
    25â†’    'tretinoin_guide',
    26â†’  ],
    27â†’  forumCategory: 'poor-skin',
    28â†’  heroMedia: {
    29â†’    id: 'skincare-hero',
    30â†’    type: 'image',
    31â†’    url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1556228720-195a672e8a03?w=1200&q=80',
    32â†’    alt: 'Clear, healthy skin and skincare',
    33â†’    placement: 'hero',
    34â†’  },
    35â†’  sections: [
    36â†’    {
    37â†’      id: 'intro',
    38â†’      title: 'The Basics of Good Skin',
    39â†’      humorLevel: 'medium',
    40â†’      content: `Your skin is literally your face. It's the first thing people see, and it significantly impacts how attractive you appear.
    41â†’
    42â†’**The Good News:**
    43â†’- Skincare is not complicated
    44â†’- Most improvements come from basics
    45â†’- Results happen in weeks to months
    46â†’- It's not expensive
    47â†’
    48â†’**The Bad News:**
    49â†’- Genetics play a role
    50â†’- Some things take time
    51â†’- There are no overnight fixes
    52â†’- Consistency is required
    53â†’
    54â†’**What Actually Works:**
    55â†’1. Cleanser (clean skin)
    56â†’2. Moisturizer (healthy barrier)
    57â†’3. Sunscreen (prevent damage)
    58â†’4. Tretinoin (for acne/anti-aging)
    59â†’
    60â†’That's the core. Everything else is optimization.`,
    61â†’    },
    62â†’    {
    63â†’      id: 'routine-basics',
    64â†’      title: 'The Basic Routine',
    65â†’      humorLevel: 'medium',
    66â†’      content: `Start here. Master this before adding anything else.
    67â†’
    68â†’**Morning Routine (2 minutes):**
    69â†’1. Rinse face with water (or gentle cleanser if oily)
    70â†’2. Apply moisturizer
    71â†’3. Apply sunscreen (non-negotiable)
    72â†’
    73â†’**Evening Routine (3 minutes):**
    74â†’1. Cleanse face (remove dirt, oil, sunscreen)
    75â†’2. Apply any actives (tretinoin, etc.)
    76â†’3. Apply moisturizer
    77â†’
    78â†’**That's It.**
    79â†’
    80â†’Don't overcomplicate. Don't buy 10 products because TikTok said so. The basic routine done consistently beats a 12-step routine done sporadically.
    81â†’
    82â†’**Order Matters:**
    83â†’Thinnest to thickest consistency:
    84â†’1. Cleansers (remove)
    85â†’2. Toners/serums (watery actives)
    86â†’3. Treatments (tretinoin, etc.)
    87â†’4. Moisturizer (seal it in)
    88â†’5. Sunscreen (protect from sun)`,
    89â†’      products: ['cerave_cleanser', 'cerave_moisturizer', 'sunscreen_elta'],
    90â†’      media: [
    91â†’        {
    92â†’          id: 'skincare-routine-infographic',
    93â†’          type: 'image',
    94â†’          url: 'https://cdn.shopify.com/s/files/1/0513/2409/files/mens_skin_care_routine_infographic.png',
    95â†’          alt: 'Men\'s daily skincare routine infographic',
    96â†’          caption: 'The basic skincare routine for all skin types',
    97â†’          placement: 'inline',
    98â†’        },
    99â†’        {
   100â†’          id: 'kdrama-facemask-gif',
   101â†’          type: 'gif',
   102â†’          url: 'https://media.giphy.com/media/1npaSqEUpFvZ5H9dqK/giphy.gif',
   103â†’          alt: 'Korean drama face mask scene',
   104â†’          caption: 'Even K-drama stars do their skincare routine',
   105â†’          placement: 'inline',
   106â†’        },
   107â†’      ],
   108â†’    },
   109â†’    {
   110â†’      id: 'cleansing',
   111â†’      title: 'Cleansing: Do It Right',
   112â†’      humorLevel: 'medium',
   113â†’      content: `Most guys either skip cleansing or do it wrong.
   114â†’
   115â†’**The Goal:**
   116â†’Remove dirt, oil, sweat, and sunscreen without stripping your skin.
   117â†’
   118â†’**How to Cleanse:**
   119â†’1. Wet face with lukewarm water (not hot)
   120â†’2. Apply dime-sized amount of cleanser
   121â†’3. Massage gently for 30-60 seconds
   122â†’4. Rinse thoroughly
   123â†’5. Pat dry (don't rub)
   124â†’
   125â†’**Choosing a Cleanser:**
   126â†’
   127â†’| Skin Type | Cleanser Type |
   128â†’|-----------|---------------|
   129â†’| Oily/Acne | Foaming/gel cleanser |
   130â†’| Normal | Either works |
   131â†’| Dry/Sensitive | Cream/hydrating cleanser |
   132â†’
   133â†’**Recommended:** CeraVe Foaming (oily) or CeraVe Hydrating (dry)
   134â†’
   135â†’**Common Mistakes:**
   136â†’1. Over-cleansing (2x daily max)
   137â†’2. Hot water (damages barrier)
   138â†’3. Harsh scrubs (causes irritation)
   139â†’4. Not rinsing fully (leaves residue)
   140â†’5. Rubbing with towel (causes friction)
   141â†’
   142â†’**The Feel:**
   143â†’After cleansing, skin should feel clean but not tight or squeaky. If it feels stripped, your cleanser is too harsh.`,
   144â†’      products: ['cerave_cleanser'],
   145â†’      media: [
   146â†’        {
   147â†’          id: 'cleansing-technique',
   148â†’          type: 'gif',
   149â†’          url: 'https://media1.tenor.com/m/WiFCFmsD9_oAAAAC/scrubbing-face-skincare.gif',
   150â†’          alt: 'Face cleansing technique',
   151â†’          caption: 'Gentle circular motions for 30-60 seconds',
   152â†’          placement: 'inline',
   153â†’        },
   154â†’        {
   155â†’          id: 'face-wash-demo',
   156â†’          type: 'gif',
   157â†’          url: 'https://media1.tenor.com/m/81EMyjB1X9IAAAAC/washing-face-getting-ready.gif',
   158â†’          alt: 'Proper face washing technique',
   159â†’          caption: 'Rinse thoroughly with lukewarm water',
   160â†’          placement: 'inline',
   161â†’        },
   162â†’      ],
   163â†’    },
   164â†’    {
   165â†’      id: 'moisturizing',
   166â†’      title: 'Moisturizing: Seal It In',
   167â†’      humorLevel: 'medium',
   168â†’      content: `A healthy skin barrier is the foundation of good skin.
   169â†’
   170â†’**Why Moisturize:**
   171â†’- Prevents water loss
   172â†’- Repairs barrier function
   173â†’- Reduces sensitivity
   174â†’- Makes skin look healthier
   175â†’- Required if using actives like tretinoin
   176â†’
   177â†’**When:**
   178â†’- Morning (after cleansing, before sunscreen)
   179â†’- Evening (after actives or as last step)
   180â†’
   181â†’**Choosing a Moisturizer:**
   182â†’
   183â†’| Skin Type | Texture |
   184â†’|-----------|---------|
   185â†’| Oily | Lightweight/gel moisturizer |
   186â†’| Normal | Lotion texture |
   187â†’| Dry | Cream texture |
   188â†’
   189â†’**Recommended:** CeraVe PM (lightweight), CeraVe Cream (thicker)
   190â†’
   191â†’**Key Ingredients to Look For:**
   192â†’- Ceramides (barrier repair)
   193â†’- Hyaluronic acid (hydration)
   194â†’- Niacinamide (reduces pores, calms skin)
   195â†’- Glycerin (hydration)
   196â†’
   197â†’**Application:**
   198â†’- Apply to slightly damp skin for better absorption
   199â†’- Use enough to cover face without being greasy
   200â†’- Don't forget neck`,
   201â†’      products: ['cerave_moisturizer'],
   202â†’    },
   203â†’    {
   204â†’      id: 'sunscreen',

   206â†’      humorLevel: 'medium-high',
   207â†’      content: `Sun damage is the biggest scam your skin is running on your future self. Block it.
   208â†’
   209â†’**The Reality:**

   220â†’
   221â†’**Choosing Sunscreen:**

   231â†’- Can leave white cast
   232â†’- Better for sensitive skin
   233â†’- Examples: Zinc oxide, titanium dioxide
   234â†’
   235â†’**Recommended:** EltaMD UV Clear SPF 46 (best for acne-prone skin)
   236â†’
   237â†’**The Excuses (And Why They're Wrong):**
   238â†’- "I don't burn" â†’ UV damage happens regardless
   239â†’- "I'm indoors" â†’ UVA goes through windows
   240â†’- "It's cloudy" â†’ 80% of UV penetrates clouds
   241â†’- "Sunscreen causes acne" â†’ Get a better sunscreen`,

   262â†’      content: `Acne is the most common skin concern. Here's how to actually treat it.
   263â†’
   264â†’**What Causes Acne:**
   265â†’1. Excess sebum (oil) production
   266â†’2. Dead skin cells clogging pores
   267â†’3. Bacteria (C. acnes)
   268â†’4. Inflammation
   269â†’
   270â†’**Types of Acne:**
   271â†’- **Comedonal:** Blackheads and whiteheads (clogged pores)
   272â†’- **Inflammatory:** Red, swollen pimples
   273â†’- **Cystic:** Deep, painful, scarring
   274â†’
   275â†’**Treatment Hierarchy:**
   276â†’
   277â†’**Level 1: Basic Routine**
   278â†’- Consistent cleansing
   279â†’- Non-comedogenic moisturizer
   280â†’- Often fixes mild acne
   281â†’
   282â†’**Level 2: Over-the-Counter Actives**
   283â†’- Benzoyl peroxide (kills bacteria)
   284â†’- Salicylic acid (unclogs pores)
   285â†’- Adapalene/Differin (retinoid, OTC)
   286â†’
   287â†’**Level 3: Prescription**
   288â†’- Tretinoin (see next section)
   289â†’- Antibiotics (temporary)
   290â†’- Spironolactone (hormonal, for women)
   291â†’
   292â†’**Level 4: Accutane/Isotretinoin**
   293â†’- Nuclear option for severe or resistant acne
   294â†’- 4-6 month course, usually permanent results
   295â†’- Side effects but highly effective
   296â†’- Requires dermatologist
   297â†’
   298â†’**General Rules:**
   299â†’- Be patient (6-12 weeks for actives to work)
   300â†’- Don't pick (causes scarring)
   301â†’- Change pillowcase frequently
   302â†’- Clean phone screen`,

   305â†’      id: 'tretinoin',
   306â†’      title: 'Tretinoin: The Gold Standard',

   308â†’      content: `Tretinoin (prescription retinoid) is the most evidence-backed skincare ingredient for both acne and anti-aging.
   309â†’
   310â†’**What It Does:**
   311â†’- Increases cell turnover
   312â†’- Unclogs pores
   313â†’- Reduces acne
   314â†’- Fades dark spots
   315â†’- Reduces fine lines

   323â†’**Starting Protocol (Critical):**

   326â†’**Week 3-4:** Every other night
   327â†’**Week 5-6:** Every night (if tolerated)
   328â†’**Ongoing:** Nightly, thin layer
   329â†’
   330â†’**The Retinization Period:**
   331â†’Expect 4-12 weeks of:
   332â†’- Dryness

   334â†’- Redness
   335â†’- Possible purging (temporary increase in acne)
   336â†’
   337â†’This is normal. Push through carefully. It gets better.
   338â†’
   339â†’**Application Tips:**

   341â†’2. Pea-sized amount for entire face
   342â†’3. Avoid eye area initially
   343â†’4. Follow with moisturizer

   345â†’
   346â†’**Don't Use With:**

   348â†’- Vitamin C (morning only)
   349â†’- Other strong actives initially
   350â†’
   351â†’**The Payoff:**
   352â†’12-month mark is where the magic happens. Consistent tretinoin use genuinely reverses aging and transforms skin.`,

   427â†’      content: `Once acne is controlled, scars may remain. Here's what helps:

   539â†’      content: `When everything else fails, there's isotretinoin (Accutane). This is the only true "cure" for severe acne.

/**

 * Humor Level: Medium (15%)

import { Guide } from '@/types/guides';

export const hairLossGuide: Guide = {
  id: 'hair-loss',
  slug: 'hair-loss-prevention',
  title: 'Hair Loss Prevention',
  subtitle: "The follicle fight you can actually winâ€”if you start now",
  description: "Complete protocol for stopping hair loss and regrowing what you've lost. The Big 3, beyond, and knowing when to accept defeat gracefully.",
  icon: 'Wind',
  humorLevel: 'medium',
  estimatedReadTime: 15,
  order: 10,
  tags: ['hair', 'finasteride', 'minoxidil', 'dht', 'norwood', 'balding', 'male-pattern'],
  relatedGuides: ['maintenance', 'skincare'],
  productIds: [
    'kirkland_minoxidil',
    'nizoral_shampoo',
    'scalp_dermaroller',
    'biotin_10000',
    'rosemary_oil',
    'rogaine_foam',
    'scalp_massager',
  ],
  forumCategory: 'hair-loss',
  heroMedia: {
    id: 'hair-loss-hero',
    type: 'image',
    url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1585747860715-2ba37e788b70?w=1200&q=80',
    alt: 'Healthy hair and scalp - the goal',
    placement: 'hero',
  },
  sections: [
    {
      id: 'intro',
      title: 'The Hard Truth About Hair Loss',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `Let's get something straight: if you're reading this, you've probably already noticed something. A few more hairs in the drain. The hairline looking different in photos. That little voice saying "is it just the lighting?"

It's probably not the lighting.

**The Good News:**
Hair loss caught early is hair loss you can fight. The Big 3 protocol works for 80%+ of men who start it in time.

**The Bad News:**
Once a follicle is dead, it's dead. No supplement, oil, or prayer is bringing it back. The only real options at that point are surgery or acceptance.

**The Bottom Line:**
If you're Norwood 1-3, you have options. If you're Norwood 4+, manage expectations. This guide covers both paths.`,
    },
    {
      id: 'norwood-scale',
      title: 'The Norwood Scale: Where Are You?',
      humorLevel: 'low',
      content: `Before we talk treatment, you need an honest assessment. The Norwood scale is the standard for male pattern baldness:

| Stage | Description | Prognosis |
|-------|-------------|-----------|
| **NW1** | Juvenile hairline, no recession | Maintainâ€”you're fine |
| **NW2** | Slight recession at temples | Monitor closely, consider prevention |
| **NW2.5** | Temple recession + early vertex thinning | Start treatment NOW |
| **NW3** | Deep temple recession | Treatment effective, act immediately |
| **NW3V** | Temple recession + crown thinning | Aggressive treatment needed |
| **NW4** | Significant balding, bridge forming | Treatment can stabilize |
| **NW5** | Bridge breaks, large bald area | Consider shaving or transplant |
| **NW6** | Only horseshoe remains | Transplant or embrace it |
| **NW7** | Maximum hair loss | Accept gracefully |

**How to Check:**
1. Wet your hair and pull it straight back
2. Take photos from front, top, and back
3. Compare to photos from 1-2 years ago
4. Check under bright lights for scalp visibility

**The Window:**
You have roughly 5-10 years from first signs to significant loss. Most guys waste 3-4 years in denial. Don't be that guy.`,
    },
    {
      id: 'big-three',
      title: 'The Big 3 Protocol',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `This is the gold standard. Everything else is supplementary.

**1. Finasteride (1mg daily)**
- **What it does:** Blocks DHT, the hormone killing your follicles
- **Effectiveness:** 80-90% halt progression, 65% regrowth
- **Timeline:** 6-12 months to see results
- **Cost:** $10-30/month generic
- **Side effects:** 1-2% experience sexual sides (usually reversible)

**2. Minoxidil (5% topical, 2x daily)**
- **What it does:** Increases blood flow to follicles, extends growth phase
- **Effectiveness:** 40% see significant improvement
- **Timeline:** 3-6 months for initial results
- **Cost:** $15-40/month
- **Side effects:** Scalp irritation, initial shedding (temporary)

**3. Ketoconazole Shampoo (2-3x weekly)**
- **What it does:** Anti-inflammatory, mild DHT blocker in scalp
- **Effectiveness:** Boosts other treatments by 10-15%
- **Timeline:** Immediate scalp improvement
- **Cost:** $15/bottle (lasts months)
- **Side effects:** Can dry scalp if overused

**The Non-Negotiables:**
- Finasteride is the foundation. Without it, you're fighting with one arm tied.
- Minoxidil without finasteride is like mopping while the sink overflows.
- Consistency is everything. Miss a month and you've reset your progress.`,
      products: ['kirkland_minoxidil', 'nizoral_shampoo'],
      tips: [
        'Take finasteride at the same time every day',
        'Apply minoxidil to DRY scalp for better absorption',
        "Initial shedding is a good signâ€”it means it's working",
      ],
      warnings: [
        "NEVER buy finasteride without a prescriptionâ€”it's prescription-only for good reason",
        'Do NOT donate blood while on finasteride (affects pregnant women)',
      ],
    },
    {
      id: 'beyond-big-three',
      title: 'Beyond the Big 3: Advanced Protocol',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `If the Big 3 alone isn't enough, here's what actually has evidence:

**Microneedling (Dermarolling)**
- 1.0-1.5mm dermaroller, once weekly
- Creates micro-injuries that boost minoxidil absorption 4x
- Studies show better results than minoxidil alone
- Wait 24hrs after needling to apply minoxidil (avoid systemic absorption)

**Oral Minoxidil**
- 2.5-5mg daily (prescription only)
- Stronger than topical but more side effects
- Can cause facial hair growth, water retention
- Requires blood pressure monitoring

**Dutasteride**
- Nuclear option for DHT blocking
- 30% stronger than finasteride
- More side effects, not FDA approved for hair
- Reserved for non-responders

**RU58841 (Research Chemical)**
- Topical anti-androgen

/**

import { Guide } from '@/types/guides';

export const antiAgingWomenGuide: Guide = {
  id: 'anti-aging-women',
  slug: 'anti-aging-women',
  title: 'Anti-Aging Guide for Women',
  subtitle: "Age gracefully, but make it strategic",
  description: "Evidence-based anti-aging from your 20s to 60s. Skincare, lifestyle, and procedures that actually work.",
  icon: 'Sparkles',

  tags: ['anti-aging', 'skincare', 'retinol', 'botox', 'collagen', 'women', 'sunscreen'],

    'lrp_spf50',

  ],
  forumCategory: 'skincare',
  heroMedia: {
    id: 'anti-aging-hero',
    type: 'image',
    url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1616394584738-fc6e612e71b9?w=1200&q=80',
    alt: 'Radiant, youthful skin at any age',
    placement: 'hero',
  },
  sections: [
    {
      id: 'intro',
      title: 'The Anti-Aging Reality',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `Let's be honest: aging is inevitable. But how you age is largely within your control.

**The Hard Truths:**
- 80% of visible aging comes from sun exposure
- You can't out-product a bad lifestyle
- Prevention is 10x more effective than reversal
- The best anti-aging routine is boring and consistent

**The Good News:**
- Starting in your 20s-30s can prevent most wrinkles
- Modern skincare actually works (if you pick the right ingredients)
- Procedures have gotten safer, more natural, and more accessible
- It's never too late to improve

**This Guide Covers:**
1. The science of skin aging
2. Skincare by decade
3. Ingredients that work (and don't)
4. Lifestyle factors
5. When to consider procedures`,
    },
    {
      id: 'science',
      title: 'How Skin Ages (The Science)',
      humorLevel: 'low',
      content: `Understanding the process helps you fight it strategically:

**Intrinsic Aging (Natural):**
- Collagen production decreases 1% per year after 25
- Elastin breaks down, skin sags
- Cell turnover slows (28 days at 20 â†’ 40+ days at 40)
- Fat pads shift and diminish
- Bones lose volume (yes, this affects your face)

**Extrinsic Aging (External):**
- **UV exposure:** Breaks down collagen, causes hyperpigmentation, wrinkles
- **Pollution:** Free radical damage, inflammation
- **Smoking:** Decreases blood flow, accelerates wrinkles
- **Sugar:** Glycation damages collagen fibers
- **Stress:** Cortisol breaks down skin structure

**Where Aging Shows First:**
| Area | Cause | Age It Shows |
|------|-------|--------------|
| Eyes (crow's feet) | Thin skin, movement | Mid-20s |
| Forehead lines | Muscle movement | Late 20s |
| Nasolabial folds | Volume loss | Early 30s |
| Neck | Sun exposure, thin skin | Mid-30s |
| Jowls | Fat descent, bone loss | Late 30s-40s |
| Upper lip lines | Collagen loss | 40s |

**The Takeaway:**
The enemies are: UV rays, oxidation, inflammation, and loss of structural support. Your strategy should target all of them.`,
    },
    {
      id: 'skincare-20s',
      title: 'Anti-Aging in Your 20s',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `This is the prevention decade. What you do now determines your 40s.

**Core Routine:**

**Morning:**
1. Gentle cleanser
2. Vitamin C serum (antioxidant protection)
3. Lightweight moisturizer
4. SPF 30-50 (non-negotiable)

**Evening:**
1. Double cleanse (oil then water-based)
2. Retinol 0.25-0.5% (start low, 2-3x weekly)
3. Hydrating serum (hyaluronic acid)
4. Moisturizer

**Key Ingredients to Start:**
| Ingredient | Why | When |
|------------|-----|------|
| Sunscreen | Prevents 80% of aging | Daily, rain or shine |
| Vitamin C | Antioxidant, brightening | Morning |
| Retinol | Increases cell turnover | Evening, build up slowly |
| Hyaluronic Acid | Hydration | Anytime |
| Niacinamide | Pores, texture, barrier | Anytime |

**Lifestyle This Decade:**
- Establish sunscreen habit NOW
- Don't smoke (ever)
- Start tretinoin if you have access
- Build consistent routine
- Less is moreâ€”don't over-complicate`,
      products: ['lrp_spf50', 'timeless_vitamin_c', 'ordinary_niacinamide'],
      tips: [
        'SPF is the single most important anti-aging product',
        'Start retinol at 0.25% and work up to avoid irritation',
        'Your neck and chest age fasterâ€”include them in your routine',
      ],
    },
    {
      id: 'skincare-30s',
      title: 'Anti-Aging in Your 30s',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `First visible signs appear. Time to get serious.

**Enhanced Routine:**

**Morning:**
1. Gentle cleanser
2. Vitamin C serum (15-20%)
3. Peptide serum or niacinamide
4. Eye cream
5. Moisturizer with antioxidants

**Evening:**
1. Double cleanse
2. Tretinoin 0.025-0.05% (or strong retinol)
3. Peptide serum (on tretinoin off-nights)
4. Eye cream (with retinol or peptides)
5. Richer moisturizer

**New Additions:**
| Product | Purpose |
|---------|---------|
| Tretinoin | Stronger than OTC retinol |
| Peptides | Signal collagen production |
| Eye-specific products | Thin skin needs targeted care |
| AHA exfoliant | Weekly chemical exfoliation |
| Neck cream | Prevention before damage |

**Lifestyle Upgrades:**
- Sleep becomes critical (skin repairs overnight)
- Consider collagen supplements (limited but some evidence)
- Antioxidant-rich diet matters more
- Stress management affects skin directly

**First Procedures to Consider:**
- Preventative Botox (forehead, crow's feet)
- Professional chemical peels
- LED light therapy`,
      products: ['paulas_retinol', 'cosrx_snail_mucin', 'collagen_peptides'],
    },
    {
      id: 'skincare-40s',
      title: 'Anti-Aging in Your 40s',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `Volume loss begins. This is where many women "hit a wall" without intervention.

**Power Routine:**

**Morning:**
1. Gentle cleanser
2. Vitamin C serum (20% with ferulic)
3. Niacinamide
4. Eye cream with peptides
5. Growth factor serum (optional)
6. Rich moisturizer
7. SPF 50

**Evening:**
1. Double cleanse
2. Tretinoin 0.05-0.1%
3. Peptide complex
4. Eye cream (retinol alternating nights)
5. Barrier repair cream

**Key Focus Areas:**
- **Eyes:** Hollowing, crow's feet, hooding
- **Nasolabial folds:** Deepening lines
- **Jawline:** Early jowl formation
- **Neck:** Horizontal lines, crepey texture
- **Hands:** Don't forget them

**Procedure Considerations:**
| Concern | Procedure | Budget |
|---------|-----------|--------|
| Lines | Botox | $300-600/visit |
| Volume loss | Cheek filler | $600-1200 |
| Texture | Microneedling | $200-700/session |
| Laxity | RF treatments | $500-3000/series |
| Brown spots | IPL or laser | $300-500/session |

**The 40s Mistake:**
Going overboard with fillers. Subtle enhancement > obvious work.`,
      products: ['timeless_vitamin_c', 'paulas_retinol', 'collagen_peptides'],
      warnings: [
        'Overfilling leads to the "pillow face" look',
        'Natural volume loss is normalâ€”some is okay',
        'Find providers who believe in subtle enhancement',
      ],
    },
    {
      id: 'skincare-50s-beyond',
      title: 'Anti-Aging: 50s and Beyond',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `Hormonal changes (menopause) dramatically affect skin. Adjust accordingly.

**Menopause Skin Changes:**
- Estrogen drop = 30% collagen loss in first 5 years
- Skin becomes drier, thinner
- Fat redistribution changes face shape
- Healing slows down

**Adapted Routine:**

**Core Adjustments:**
- Richer, more occlusive moisturizers
- May need to reduce tretinoin frequency
- Focus on barrier repair
- More emphasis on hydration

**Additional Considerations:**
| Issue | Solution |
|-------|----------|
| Extreme dryness | Facial oils, sleeping masks |
| Thinning skin | Gentler exfoliation |
| Sagging | RF treatments, threads |
| Deep wrinkles | Filler, laser resurfacing |
| Neck laxity | Ultherapy, threads, surgery |

**Procedure Considerations:**
- Thread lifts for subtle lift
- Fat grafting for volume (more permanent than filler)
- Lower facelift discussion
- Neck lift if significant laxity
- Laser resurfacing for texture

**Mindset Shift:**
The goal isn't to look 30. It's to look like the best version of your current age. Chasing youth leads to overdone results.`,
      tips: [
        'HRT may help skin if appropriate for you (discuss with doctor)',
        'Facial exercises have some evidence for muscle toning',
        'Sleep position mattersâ€”back sleeping reduces sleep wrinkles',
      ],
    },
    {
      id: 'ingredients',
      title: 'Ingredients That Actually Work',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `Cut through the marketing. Here's what has real evidence:

**Tier 1: Strong Evidence**
| Ingredient | What It Does | Notes |
|------------|--------------|-------|
| **Tretinoin** | Gold standard, increases collagen, cell turnover | Prescription only, start low |
| **Sunscreen** | Prevents 80% of aging | Daily, SPF 30+ |
| **Vitamin C** | Antioxidant, brightening, collagen support | L-ascorbic acid most studied |
| **Niacinamide** | Barrier repair, pores, fine lines | 4-5%, well tolerated |

**Tier 2: Good Evidence**
| Ingredient | What It Does | Notes |
|------------|--------------|-------|
| **Retinol** | OTC version of tretinoin | Weaker but fewer side effects |
| **Alpha Hydroxy Acids** | Exfoliation, texture | Glycolic, lactic acid |
| **Peptides** | Signal collagen production | Copper peptides, Matrixyl |
| **Azelaic Acid** | Brightening, anti-inflammatory | Good for sensitive skin |

**Tier 3: Some Evidence**
| Ingredient | What It Does | Notes |
|------------|--------------|-------|
| **Hyaluronic Acid** | Hydration (not anti-aging per se) | Plumps temporarily |
| **Vitamin E** | Antioxidant support | Best paired with C |
| **Bakuchiol** | Plant-based retinol alternative | Gentler, less proven |
| **Resveratrol** | Antioxidant | Limited data |

**Marketing Hype (Limited Evidence):**
- Most "stem cell" products
- Collagen creams (molecules too big to penetrate)
- "Anti-aging" serums without listed actives
- Expensive does not equal effective`,
      products: ['paulas_retinol', 'timeless_vitamin_c', 'ordinary_niacinamide'],
    },
    {
      id: 'lifestyle',
      title: 'Lifestyle Factors: The Unsexy Truth',
      humorLevel: 'medium-high',
      content: `You can't out-product a bad lifestyle. These matter more than any serum:

**Sleep (7-9 hours)**
- Growth hormone released during deep sleep
- Skin repairs itself at night
- Sleep deprivation = elevated cortisol = collagen breakdown
- Back sleeping prevents sleep wrinkles

**Diet**
| Do | Don't |
|-----|-------|
| Antioxidant-rich foods | High sugar (glycation) |
| Omega-3 fatty acids | Excessive alcohol |
| Lean protein | Processed foods |
| Colorful vegetables | Chronic inflammation triggers |

**Exercise**
- Increases blood flow to skin
- Reduces cortisol
- May actually reverse some skin aging (studies show thicker dermis)
- Overdoing it (extreme endurance) can accelerate aging

**Stress Management**
- Chronic stress = chronic inflammation = accelerated aging
- Cortisol breaks down collagen
- Meditation, therapy, lifestyle design

**The Things Nobody Wants to Hear:**
- Alcohol dehydrates and accelerates aging (even "moderate")
- Sugar literally degrades collagen through glycation
- Smoking adds 10+ years to your face
- Yo-yo dieting damages skin elasticity`,
    },
    {
      id: 'procedures-overview',
      title: 'Procedures: What Actually Works',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `When skincare isn't enough. Organized by what they treat:

**For Lines/Wrinkles:**
| Procedure | How It Works | Duration | Cost |
|-----------|--------------|----------|------|
| Botox | Relaxes muscles | 3-4 months | $300-600 |
| Filler | Adds volume | 6-18 months | $600-1500 |
| Microneedling | Collagen stimulation | Progressive | $200-700 |
| Laser resurfacing | Ablative renewal | Years | $1000-5000 |

**For Volume Loss:**
| Procedure | How It Works | Duration | Cost |
|-----------|--------------|----------|------|
| HA Filler | Restores volume | 12-18 months | $600-1500 |
| Fat transfer | Uses your own fat | Years-permanent | $3000-8000 |
| Sculptra | Stimulates collagen | 2+ years | $700-1000/vial |

**For Sagging:**
| Procedure | How It Works | Duration | Cost |
|-----------|--------------|----------|------|
| RF treatments | Tightens with heat | 1-3 years | $500-3000 |
| Ultherapy | Ultrasound tightening | 1-2 years | $2000-5000 |
| Thread lift | Mechanical lift | 1-2 years | $1500-4500 |
| Facelift | Surgical tightening | 10+ years | $10,000-25,000 |

**For Texture/Spots:**
| Procedure | How It Works | Duration | Cost |
|-----------|--------------|----------|------|
| Chemical peel | Exfoliation | 3-6 months | $150-300 |
| IPL | Targets pigment | Yearly touch-up | $300-500 |
| Fractional laser | Resurfaces skin | Years | $800-2000 |`,
    },
    {
      id: 'common-mistakes',
      title: 'Common Anti-Aging Mistakes',
      humorLevel: 'high',
      content: `Don't be these women:

**Mistake 1: Skipping Sunscreen**
"But I'm only outside for a minute." UV damage is cumulative. Every minute counts.

**Mistake 2: Starting Too Late**
Waiting until wrinkles appear to start prevention. By then you're doing damage control.

**Mistake 3: Product Overload**
10-step routines with 15 actives = irritated, damaged skin. Quality over quantity.

**Mistake 4: Chasing Trends**
Every month there's a new "miracle" ingredient. The basics haven't changed in decades.

**Mistake 5: Overfilling**
The pillow face. Chipmunk cheeks. Trying to look 25 at 55. Less is more.

**Mistake 6: Ignoring Lifestyle**
$500 serums while sleeping 5 hours and drinking daily. Address the root causes.

**Mistake 7: Neck/Hand Neglect**
Perfect face, aged neck. Hands that give away your real age.

**Mistake 8: All or Nothing**
Either doing nothing or doing everything. Find sustainable middle ground.

**Mistake 9: Comparing to Celebrities**
They have access to procedures, lighting, and editing you don't see.`,
    },
    {
      id: 'budget-guide',
      title: 'Anti-Aging by Budget',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `What you can achieve at different price points:

**Under $50/month:**
- Sunscreen (SPF 30+): $15
- Tretinoin (generic): $10-30
- Basic moisturizer: $10

- *Result:* Maximum non-surgical results

**Best ROI Order:**
1. Sunscreen (prevent future damage)
2. Tretinoin (reverse and prevent)

4. Botox (when lines appear)
5. Everything else

**The $50/month routine with sunscreen and tretinoin will beat the $300/month routine without them.**`,
      products: ['lrp_spf50', 'paulas_retinol', 'timeless_vitamin_c'],
    },
    {
      id: 'action-plan',
      title: 'Your Anti-Aging Action Plan',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `Here's how to start, no matter your age:

**Week 1: Foundation**
- Buy a good SPF 30-50 (and use it daily)
- Get a gentle cleanser
- Get a basic moisturizer
- Wear sunscreen even indoors (windows transmit UVA)

**Week 2-4: Add Retinoid**
- Start with 0.25% retinol or prescription 0.025% tretinoin

- Build up tolerance over 4-8 weeks
- Expect some peeling/dryness

**Month 2: Add Vitamin C**
- Morning routine, before sunscreen
- L-ascorbic acid 15-20% is gold standard
- Store in dark, cool place
- Replace every 3-6 months

**Month 3+: Customize**
Based on your concerns:
- Dullness â†’ Niacinamide, AHAs
- Dehydration â†’ Hyaluronic acid, richer moisturizer
- Lines â†’ Peptides, consider Botox
- Volume loss â†’ Consider filler consultation

**The Commitment:**
- This is a lifetime practice
- Results are slow but compound
- Consistency beats intensity
- Take progress photos every 6 months

**What Success Looks Like:**
Not looking 20 at 50. Looking like the best, healthiest, most rested version of your actual age.`,
      products: ['lrp_spf50', 'paulas_retinol', 'timeless_vitamin_c', 'ordinary_niacinamide'],
    },
  ],
};

content.content:
1â†’/**
     2â†’ * Training Splits Guide
     3â†’ * Humor Level: Medium (15%)
     4â†’ */
     5â†’
     6â†’import { Guide } from '@/types/guides';
     7â†’
     8â†’export const trainingGuide: Guide = {
     9â†’  id: 'training',
    10â†’  slug: 'training-splits',
    11â†’  title: 'Training Splits',
    12â†’  subtitle: "Stop wandering the gym confused",
    13â†’  description: "Structured workout programs for different experience levels and schedules. No more random workouts.",
    14â†’  icon: 'Calendar',
    15â†’  humorLevel: 'medium',
    16â†’  estimatedReadTime: 12,
    17â†’  order: 5,
    18â†’  tags: ['training', 'workout', 'gym', 'programming', 'splits'],
    19â†’  relatedGuides: ['v-taper', 'core-neck', 'cardio'],
    20â†’  productIds: ['creatine_mono'],
    21â†’  forumCategory: 'body-composition',
    22â†’  heroMedia: {
    23â†’    id: 'training-hero',
    24â†’    type: 'image',
    25â†’    url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1534438327276-14e5300c3a48?w=1200&q=80',
    26â†’    alt: 'Athlete performing compound lift in gym',
    27â†’    placement: 'hero',
    28â†’  },
    29â†’  sections: [
    30â†’    {
    31â†’      id: 'intro',
    32â†’      title: 'Why Your Split Matters',
    33â†’      humorLevel: 'medium',
    34â†’      content: `Walking into the gym without a plan is like going to the grocery store hungryâ€”you'll make bad decisions and leave unsatisfied.
    35â†’
    36â†’---
    37â†’
    38â†’## The Problem
    39â†’
    40â†’Most guys either:
    41â†’
    42â†’- Do random exercises they saw on Instagram
    43â†’- Hit chest and arms every day, ignoring everything else
    44â†’- Overcomplicate with 6-day PPL splits when they can barely make it 3x/week
    45â†’- Follow a pro bodybuilder's routine when they've been lifting for 6 months
    46â†’
    47â†’## The Fix
    48â†’
    49â†’Choose a split that matches your:
    50â†’
    51â†’- **Available training days** â€” Be realistic
    52â†’- **Experience level** â€” Beginners need less volume
    53â†’- **Recovery capacity** â€” Sleep, stress, nutrition all matter
    54â†’- **Goals** â€” Strength vs hypertrophy vs both
    55â†’
    56â†’Then stick with it for at least 8-12 weeks before changing anything.`,
    57â†’      media: [
    58â†’        {
    59â†’          id: 'gym-planning',
    60â†’          type: 'image',
    61â†’          url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1571019614242-c5c5dee9f50b?w=800&q=80',
    62â†’          alt: 'Athlete writing workout plan',
    63â†’          caption: 'A written plan is the difference between progress and spinning wheels',
    64â†’          placement: 'inline',
    65â†’        },
    66â†’        {
    67â†’          id: 'pudgy-workout-gif',
    68â†’          type: 'gif',
    69â†’          url: 'https://media.giphy.com/media/HMzHH3J2RbHzPbRJH5/giphy.gif',
    70â†’          alt: 'Pudgy penguin lifting weights',
    71â†’          caption: 'No excuses. Get to work.',
    72â†’          placement: 'inline',
    73â†’        },
    74â†’      ],
    75â†’    },
    76â†’    {
    77â†’      id: 'fundamentals',
    78â†’      title: 'Training Fundamentals (All Splits)',
    79â†’      humorLevel: 'medium',
    80â†’      content: `Before we get into splits, these principles apply to everything:
    81â†’
    82â†’---
    83â†’
    84â†’## 1. Progressive Overload
    85â†’
    86â†’You must increase weight, reps, or sets over time. If you're lifting the same weight for the same reps month after month, you're not growing.
    87â†’
    88â†’## 2. Volume Matters
    89â†’
    90â†’| Weekly Sets Per Muscle | Effect |
    91â†’|------------------------|--------|
    92â†’| **< 10 sets** | Probably not enough for growth |
    93â†’| **10-20 sets** | Hypertrophy sweet spot |
    94â†’| **> 20 sets** | Diminishing returns |
    95â†’
    96â†’## 3. Intensity (Effort)
    97â†’
    98â†’Most sets should be within 1-3 reps of failure. If you could do 5 more reps, you're not working hard enough.
    99â†’
   100â†’## 4. Recovery
   101â†’
   102â†’Muscles grow when you rest, not when you lift:
   103â†’
   104â†’- Sleep 7-9 hours
   105â†’- Eat enough protein
   106â†’- Take rest days seriously
   107â†’
   108â†’## 5. Consistency > Perfection
   109â†’
   110â†’A 3-day routine done consistently beats a 6-day routine you keep missing. Pick something sustainable.`,
   111â†’      tips: [
   112â†’        'Track your liftsâ€”what gets measured gets managed',

   121â†’      content: `**Best For:**
   122â†’- Beginners (first 6-12 months)
   123â†’- Busy schedules (only 3 gym days)
   124â†’- Coming back after time off
   125â†’
   126â†’---
   127â†’
   128â†’## Why It Works

   131â†’- More practice with compounds

   144â†’| | Barbell Row | 3x8-10 |
   145â†’| | Overhead Press | 3x10-12 |

   149â†’| | Incline DB Press | 3x10-12 |
   150â†’| | Lat Pulldown | 3x10-12 |
   151â†’| | Leg Press | 3x12-15 |
   152â†’| | Tricep Pushdowns | 2x12-15 |
   153â†’| **Friday** | | |
   154â†’| | Squat | 3x8-10 |
   155â†’| | Overhead Press | 3x8-10 |
   156â†’| | Pull-Ups | 3xMax |
   157â†’| | Romanian Deadlift | 3x10-12 |
   158â†’| | Face Pulls | 3x15-20 |
   159â†’
   160â†’---
   161â†’
   162â†’## Progression

   184â†’    {

   186â†’      title: 'Upper/Lower Split (4 Days/Week)',

   188â†’      content: `**Best For:**
   189â†’- Intermediate lifters (1+ years)
   190â†’- Those with 4 consistent gym days
   191â†’- Balanced development focus

   193â†’---

   201â†’
   202â†’---
   203â†’
   204â†’## Sample Week
   205â†’
   206â†’### Upper A (Monday)
   207â†’

   248â†’---

   250â†’**Notes:**

   252â†’- Rest at least one day between training the same muscles`,
   253â†’      media: [
   254â†’        {
   255â†’          id: 'deadlift-form',
   256â†’          type: 'image',
   257â†’          url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1598268030450-7a476f602e5c?w=800&q=80',

   271â†’    },
   272â†’    {
   273â†’      id: 'ppl',
   274â†’      title: 'Push/Pull/Legs Split (6 Days/Week)',
   275â†’      humorLevel: 'medium',
   276â†’      content: `**Best For:**
   277â†’- Intermediate to advanced (2+ years)
   278â†’- Those with 5-6 gym days available
   279â†’- Maximum volume and frequency goals
   280â†’
   281â†’---
   282â†’
   283â†’## Why It Works
   284â†’
   285â†’- High frequency (2x per muscle per week)
   286â†’- High volume per session
   287â†’- Clear organization
   288â†’- Most popular split for bodybuilding
   289â†’
   290â†’---
   291â†’
   292â†’## The Structure
   293â†’
   294â†’| Day | Focus | Key Muscles |
   295â†’|-----|-------|-------------|
   296â†’| **Push A** | Heavy compounds | Chest, Shoulders, Triceps |
   297â†’| **Pull A** | Heavy compounds | Back, Biceps, Rear Delts |
   298â†’| **Legs A** | Heavy compounds | Quads, Hamstrings, Calves |
   299â†’| **Push B** | Volume focus | Same muscles, different angles |
   300â†’| **Pull B** | Volume focus | Same muscles, different angles |
   301â†’| **Legs B** | Volume focus | Same muscles, different emphasis |
   302â†’
   303â†’---
   304â†’
   305â†’## Sample Push Day
   306â†’
   307â†’| Exercise | Sets x Reps | Notes |
   308â†’|----------|-------------|-------|
   309â†’| Bench Press | 4x6-8 | Main compound |
   310â†’| Overhead Press | 3x8-10 | Secondary compound |
   311â†’| Incline DB Press | 3x10-12 | Upper chest focus |
   312â†’| Lateral Raises | 4x15-20 | Side delt isolation |
   313â†’| Tricep Dips | 3x8-12 | Compound tricep |
   314â†’| Cable Pushdowns | 3x12-15 | Isolation finisher |
   315â†’
   316â†’---
   317â†’
   318â†’> **Warning:** This is a lot of volume. If you're not sleeping 8+ hours and eating 1g/lb protein, you won't recover properly.`,
   319â†’      media: [
   320â†’        {
   321â†’          id: 'ppl-split-banner',
   322â†’          type: 'image',
   323â†’          url: 'https://cdn.muscleandstrength.com/sites/default/files/6_day_ppl_-_1200x630.jpg',
   324â†’          alt: '6-day Push Pull Legs workout split overview',
   325â†’          caption: 'The classic 6-day PPL split: Push, Pull, Legs repeated twice',
   326â†’          placement: 'inline',
   327â†’        },
   328â†’        {
   329â†’          id: 'ohp-form',
   330â†’          type: 'image',
   331â†’          url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1541534741688-6078c6bfb5c5?w=800&q=80',
   332â†’          alt: 'Proper overhead press form demonstration',
   333â†’          caption: 'Overhead Press: Brace core, press straight up, head through at top',
   334â†’          placement: 'inline',
   335â†’        },
   336â†’        {
   337â†’          id: 'lateral-raise',
   338â†’          type: 'image',
   339â†’          url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1581009146145-b5ef050c149a?w=800&q=80',
   340â†’          alt: 'Athlete performing dumbbell exercises',
   341â†’          caption: 'Lateral Raise: Slight bend in elbows, lead with pinkies',
   342â†’          placement: 'inline',
   343â†’        },
   344â†’      ],
   345â†’    },
   346â†’    {
   347â†’      id: 'bro-split',
   348â†’      title: 'Bro Split (5 Days/Week)',
   349â†’      humorLevel: 'medium-high',
   350â†’      content: `## The Classic
   351â†’
   352â†’| Day | Focus |
   353â†’|-----|-------|
   354â†’| Monday | Chest |
   355â†’| Tuesday | Back |
   356â†’| Wednesday | Shoulders |
   357â†’| Thursday | Arms |
   358â†’| Friday | Legs |
   359â†’
   360â†’---
   361â†’
   362â†’## The Truth
   363â†’
   364â†’The bro split is often mocked as "suboptimal" because each muscle only gets hit once per week.
   365â†’
   366â†’Science says 2x per week frequency is better for hypertrophy.
   367â†’
   368â†’---
   369â†’
   370â†’## But Here's the Thing
   371â†’
   372â†’If you've been training for years and want maximum volume per session, or if it's the only split you'll stick to consistently, it can still work.
   373â†’
   374â†’### When It Makes Sense
   375â†’
   376â†’- Advanced lifters who need 15-20+ sets per muscle
   377â†’- Those who enjoy destroying one muscle group per session
   378â†’- People who've tried other splits and prefer this
   379â†’
   380â†’### When It Doesn't
   381â†’
   382â†’- Beginners (you don't need that much volume)
   383â†’- People who miss gym days frequently
   384â†’- Natural lifters who benefit from frequency
   385â†’
   386â†’---
   387â†’
   388â†’## The Compromise
   389â†’
   390â†’If you like the bro split style, consider hitting each muscle 1.5x per week:
   391â†’
   392â†’- Chest + Triceps
   393â†’- Back + Biceps
   394â†’- Shoulders + Legs (light)
   395â†’- Arms + Rear Delts
   396â†’- Legs (heavy)`,
   397â†’    },
   398â†’    {
   399â†’      id: 'exercise-selection',
   400â†’      title: 'Choosing the Right Exercises',
   401â†’      humorLevel: 'medium',
   402â†’      content: `Not all exercises are equal. Here's how to prioritize:
   403â†’
   404â†’---
   405â†’
   406â†’## Tier 1: Compound Movements (Build Your Foundation)
   407â†’
   408â†’These should make up 60-70% of your training:
   409â†’
   410â†’| Movement Pattern | Exercises |
   411â†’|------------------|-----------|
   412â†’| **Squat** | Back Squat, Front Squat, Goblet Squat |
   413â†’| **Hinge** | Deadlift, RDL, Good Morning |
   414â†’| **Horizontal Push** | Bench Press, DB Press, Push-Ups |
   415â†’| **Horizontal Pull** | Barbell Row, DB Row, Cable Row |
   416â†’| **Vertical Push** | Overhead Press, DB Shoulder Press |
   417â†’| **Vertical Pull** | Pull-Ups, Lat Pulldown, Chin-Ups |
   418â†’
   419â†’---
   420â†’
   421â†’## Tier 2: Compound Accessories
   422â†’
   423â†’- Lunges, leg press, RDLs
   424â†’- Dips, incline press
   425â†’- Face pulls, rear delt work
   426â†’- Curl and tricep compound movements
   427â†’
   428â†’## Tier 3: Isolation (Target Weaknesses)
   429â†’
   430â†’- Lateral raises (for V-taper)
   431â†’- Bicep curls (for arm peak)
   432â†’- Tricep extensions (for arm size)
   433â†’- Leg curls/extensions (for leg detail)
   434â†’- Calf raises (for calf size)
   435â†’
   436â†’---
   437â†’
   438â†’> **The Mistake:** Building your routine around cable machines and isolation exercises. These are supplements to compounds, not replacements.`,
   439â†’      tips: [
   440â†’        'Master form on compounds before going heavy',
   441â†’        'Isolations are for lagging body parts',
   442â†’        'If short on time, cut isolations first, never compounds',
   443â†’      ],
   444â†’      media: [
   445â†’        {
   446â†’          id: 'row-form',
   447â†’          type: 'image',
   448â†’          url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1603287681836-b174ce5074c2?w=800&q=80',
   449â†’          alt: 'Athlete performing back exercises',
   450â†’          caption: 'Barbell Row: 45-degree torso, pull to lower chest',
   451â†’          placement: 'inline',
   452â†’        },
   453â†’      ],
   454â†’    },
   455â†’    {
   456â†’      id: 'rep-ranges',
   457â†’      title: 'Rep Ranges and What They Do',
   458â†’      humorLevel: 'low',
   459â†’      content: `Different rep ranges serve different purposes:
   460â†’
   461â†’---
   462â†’
   463â†’## The Ranges
   464â†’
   465â†’| Reps | Focus | Best For |
   466â†’|------|-------|----------|
   467â†’| **1-5** | Strength | Compounds (squat, bench, deadlift) |
   468â†’| **6-12** | Hypertrophy | Most trainingâ€”the sweet spot |
   469â†’| **12-20+** | Metabolic/Pump | Small muscles, finishing sets |
   470â†’
   471â†’---
   472â†’
   473â†’## The Reality
   474â†’
   475â†’Muscles grow across all rep ranges when taken close to failure.
   476â†’
   477â†’The "6-12 for hypertrophy" rule is a guideline, not a law.
   478â†’
   479â†’## Practical Application
   480â†’
   481â†’| Exercise Type | Rep Range |
   482â†’|---------------|-----------|
   483â†’| **Compounds** | 5-10 reps |
   484â†’| **Secondary compounds** | 8-12 reps |
   485â†’| **Isolations** | 10-20 reps |
   486â†’
   487â†’Mix it up within these guidelines for variety.`,
   488â†’    },
   489â†’    {
   490â†’      id: 'progression',
   491â†’      title: 'How to Progress',
   492â†’      humorLevel: 'medium',
   493â†’      content: `If you're not progressing, you're not growing. Here's how to ensure constant improvement:
   494â†’
   495â†’---
   496â†’
   497â†’## Method 1: Linear Progression (Beginners)
   498â†’
   499â†’Add weight every session:
   500â†’
   501â†’| Week | Bench Press |
   502â†’|------|-------------|
   503â†’| 1 | 135 x 3x8 |
   504â†’| 2 | 140 x 3x8 |
   505â†’| 3 | 145 x 3x8 |
   506â†’| 4 | 150 x 3x8 |
   507â†’
   508â†’Continue until you stall.
   509â†’
   510â†’---
   511â†’
   512â†’## Method 2: Double Progression (Intermediate)
   513â†’
   514â†’Work within a rep range, increase weight when you hit the top:
   515â†’
   516â†’| Week | Weight x Sets x Reps |
   517â†’|------|---------------------|
   518â†’| 1 | 185 x 3x8 |
   519â†’| 2 | 185 x 3x9 |
   520â†’| 3 | 185 x 3x10 |
   521â†’| 4 | 190 x 3x8 (restart) |
   522â†’
   523â†’---
   524â†’
   525â†’## Method 3: Volume Progression (Advanced)
   526â†’
   527â†’Keep weight same, add sets:
   528â†’
   529â†’| Week | Sets |
   530â†’|------|------|
   531â†’| 1 | 3 sets |
   532â†’| 2 | 4 sets |
   533â†’| 3 | 5 sets |
   534â†’| 4 | Deload |
   535â†’
   536â†’---
   537â†’
   538â†’## When You Stall
   539â†’
   540â†’1. Check sleep and nutrition first
   541â†’2. Deload (reduce volume/intensity for 1 week)
   542â†’3. Try a different rep range or exercise variation
   543â†’4. Accept that progress slows after the beginner phase`,
   544â†’    },
   545â†’    {
   546â†’      id: 'choosing-split',
   547â†’      title: 'Which Split Should You Choose?',
   548â†’      humorLevel: 'medium',
   549â†’      content: `The best split is the one you'll actually do consistently. Here's the decision tree:
   550â†’
   551â†’---
   552â†’
   553â†’## How many days can you REALISTICALLY train per week?
   554â†’
   555â†’| Days Available | Recommended Split |
   556â†’|----------------|-------------------|
   557â†’| **3 Days** | Full Body |
   558â†’| **4 Days** | Upper/Lower |
   559â†’| **5 Days** | Upper/Lower/Upper/Lower/Full or modified PPL |
   560â†’| **6 Days** | PPL (Push/Pull/Legs 2x) |
   561â†’
   562â†’---
   563â†’
   564â†’## Quick Guide
   565â†’
   566â†’### 3 Days â†’ Full Body
   567â†’- Best bang for buck with limited time
   568â†’- Perfect for beginners
   569â†’
   570â†’### 4 Days â†’ Upper/Lower
   571â†’- Great balance of volume and recovery
   572â†’- Good for most intermediates
   573â†’
   574â†’### 5 Days â†’ Flexible
   575â†’- More flexibility
   576â†’- Good volume and frequency
   577â†’
   578â†’### 6 Days â†’ PPL
   579â†’- Maximum volume and frequency
   580â†’- Requires excellent recovery
   581â†’- Advanced or great genetics
   582â†’
   583â†’---
   584â†’
   585â†’> **Be Honest With Yourself:** If you're planning a 6-day split but realistically make it 3-4 times per week, you're doing yourself a disservice. A 4-day split done consistently beats a 6-day split done randomly.`,
   586â†’      products: ['creatine_mono'],
   587â†’    },
   588â†’    {
   589â†’      id: 'action-plan',
   590â†’      title: 'Your Action Plan',
   591â†’      humorLevel: 'medium',
   592â†’      content: `Here's what to do:
   593â†’
   594â†’---
   595â†’
   596â†’## Step 1: Choose Your Split
   597â†’
   598â†’Based on your available training days and experience level. When in doubt, go with fewer days and build up.
   599â†’
   600â†’## Step 2: Write It Down
   601â†’
   602â†’Physically write or type your routine. Every exercise, sets, reps, and rest periods.
   603â†’
   604â†’## Step 3: Track Every Workout
   605â†’
   606â†’Use an app or notebook. Record weight x reps for every set.
   607â†’
   608â†’## Step 4: Progress Each Session
   609â†’
   610â†’Add weight, reps, or sets whenever possible. If you completed all prescribed reps, increase something next time.
   611â†’
   612â†’## Step 5: Stick With It
   613â†’
   614â†’**Minimum 8-12 weeks before changing programs.**
   615â†’
   616â†’Program hopping is one of the biggest gains killers.
   617â†’
   618â†’## Step 6: Deload When Needed
   619â†’
   620â†’Every 4-6 weeks, take a lighter week. This isn't weaknessâ€”it's smart programming.
   621â†’
   622â†’---
   623â†’
   624â†’> The gym is simple: show up, lift more than last time, recover, repeat. Don't overcomplicate it.`,
   625â†’    },
   626â†’  ],
   627â†’};
   628â†’

<system-reminder>
